VRP States and classes¶

CvrptwState¶

class cvrptw.myvrplib.vrpstates.CvrptwState(n_vehicles: int, vehicle_capacity: int, map_file: str, dataset: dict | DataFrame | str, list_of_depot_stops: list = [3404], routes: list[Route] = None, routes_cost: list = None, given_unassigned: list = None, distances: ndarray = None, current_time: int = 0, seed: int = 0)¶

Class representing the state of the CVRPTW problem.

Attributes:

routes: list

List of routes in the state.

routes_cost: list

List of costs of each route.

dataset: dict or pd.DataFrame

Dictionary or pd.DataFrame containing the dataset.

twc_format_nodes_df: pd.DataFrame

DataFrame containing the dataset in the format used for time window compatibility matrix computation.

cust_to_nodes: dict

Dictionary mapping customer IDs to node IDs.

unassigned: list

List of unassigned customers’ IDs (NOT node IDs). To get node IDs use mapping cust_to_nodes.

cust_df: pd.DataFrame

DataFrame containing the customers data.

seed: int

Seed for the random number generator.

distances: np.ndarray

Matrix of distances between each pair of customers.

twc: np.ndarray

Time window compatibility matrix.

qmax: float

Maximum demand of any customer.

dmax: float

Maximum distance between any two customers.

norm_tw: np.ndarray

Normalized time window compatibility matrix.

n_vehicles: int

Number of vehicles in the dataset.

depots: dict

Dictionary containing the depots information

n_customers: int

Number of customers in the dataset.

vehicle_capacity: int

Capacity of the vehicles in the dataset.

current_time: int

Current time of the simulation.

calculate_planned_times(route_index: int)¶

Calculate the planned arrival and departure times for each customer in the route.

compute_route_demand(route_idx: int) → None¶

Compute the demand of a route and store in the route object. Parameters:

route_idx: int

Index of the route.

Returns:

None

property cost¶

Alias for objective method. Used for plotting.

find_index_in_route(node, route: Route)¶
Return index of the node in the route.
Arguments:
node: int

The node to find.

route: Route

The route where to find the node.

find_route(customer: int) → tuple¶
Return the route that contains the passed-in customer.
Parameters:
customer: int

The customer ID to find.

Returns:
tuple

The route that contains the customer and its index.

get_dmax()¶

Get the maximum distance between any two customers.

get_qmax()¶

Get the maximum demand of any customer.

insert_node_in_route_at_idx(node: int, route_idx: int, node_idx: int) → None¶

Insert a node in a given route. This means updating the route, the customer DataFrame, the twc_format_nodes_df, the route cost, the route demand, the planned times and the unassigned list if the delivery node is already inserted. Parameters:

node: int

The node to be inserted.

route_idx: int

The index of the route where the node will be inserted.

node_idx: int

The index where the node will be inserted.

Returns:

None

property n_planned_customers¶

Return the number of served customers.

objective()¶

Computes the total route costs.

planned_customers()¶

Return the list of served customers.

route_cost_calculator(route_id: int)¶

Compute the cost of a route.

served_nodes()¶

Return the list of served nodes.

update_est_lst(route_index: int)¶

Calculates vectors of the earliest (EST) and latest (LST) start times for each NODE in the route. Based on equations (3b) and (13) of Wang et al. (2024). Parameters:

route_index: int

Index of the route.

Returns:

None

update_times_attributes_routes(route_index: int)¶

Update the start, end and planned times for each customer in the routes.

update_unassigned_list()¶

Update the list of unassigned customers.
